abstract: The Cardinals' Game 6 victory almost defied description, but that didn't stop sportswriters.
snippet: The Cardinals' Game 6 victory almost defied description, but that didn't stop sportswriters.
lead_paragraph: So Game 6 of the World Series was full of enough thrills for a year of amusement park visits, the crazy, sloppy humanness of the first six innings followed by the wild, whose-turn-is-it-to-be-a-superhero final innings that seemed able to go on forever until David Freese's towering, preposterous home run dropped onto the lawn beyond Busch Stadium's center-field fence. It left only one question remaining:

headline.main: Leading Off: How Many Ways to Say Wow?
